Other Information.Test Conditions: 0.1 mol L^-1 N2-saturated PBS (pH 7.0), -0.4 V vs. Ag/AgCl
Other Information.Additional Info: The selectivity is due to the size exclusion provided by Cu-MOFs; H2O2 can be adsorbed while larger species such as UA and glucose cannot.

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Linear detection range: 2.00 × 10^-7 to 1.85 × 10^-4 mol L^-1, Sensitivity: 0.792 A (mol L^-1)^-1, Detection limit: 6.7 × 10^-8 mol L^-1

Other Information.Additional Info: The Cu-MOF/graphene composite exhibited high electrocatalytic activity for H2O2 reduction, attributed to synergistic catalysis from graphene conductivity and Cu-MOF porosity.
